actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Armed Services.

official_title: A bill to amend title 10, United States Code, to improve the opportunity of nurses and medical specialists for appointment and promotion in the Regular Army or Regular Air Force, and authorize their retention beyond the mandatory retirement age.

summary.text: Provides that original appointments in the Regular Army may be made in the grades of second lieutenant through colonel in the Army Corps or Army Medical Specialist Corps from qualified persons who have not passed their thirtieth birthday. Permits the maximum age to be increased by the period credited to an appointee for the purpose of determining grade, seniority or eligibility for promotion. (Amends 10 U.S.C. 3291)

titles.title: A bill to amend title 10, United States Code, to improve the opportunity of nurses and medical specialists for appointment and promotion in the Regular Army or Regular Air Force, and authorize their retention beyond the mandatory retirement age.
